intro: Epacris riparia, commonly known as the common epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded or semi-shaded environments, such as woodland areas. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract nectar-feeding insects. Epacris riparia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
